title: Riot I don't want to wait other 4 patches to see TankFiora's Balances
body:

Moreover, Can someone explain to me why she has   345 base M.Speed  when She has a closegap every 2 sec (if it hits an enemy and  a little bit of CDR) m.speed extra from her passive and strong slow on her E and W? ?? Dou you Remember the reasoning of Riven's m speed nerf? Here apply it here because there is a reason not to do it .... EQUITY, two weights, a measure.
Same reasoning for her damage: ekko was a problem for his utility and his damage? Full Tank  and still inflicted too much damage ?? Nerf  base damage and buff scaling. So it must be Fiora, 2 weights, a measure. 
I really hope Someone at riot's team is working in this direction because I don't think  that they have predicted   the  tank build was so effective on fiora.

Here's the thing: Fiora's bases are actually not that great.  Her base AD at level 18 is 116 - respectable, but not anywhere close to the highest (Morde at 146, followed closely by Illaoi at 145).  Lunge does all of 105 base damage at rank 5, less than an auto-attack.  Riposte is noticeably more (250) but it scales off AP, and since Triforce no longer has AP, Fiora isn't building any AP outside of Natural Talent.  It's also magic damage, and she's not really going to have magic pen.  Her passive has a flat value as well, at 3% max hp.  It scales off of AD as well, but all of Fiora's AD scalings are bonus AD.  As someone else mentioned, she needs a fair bit of AD to really hurt.

In regards to tank Fiora...  Well, I hate to be a hipster, but I was building bruiser Fiora before everyone started building Titanic, and you do nowhere near as much damage as a full AD Fiora does.  Full AD Fiora blows people up in 2-3 hits, if she can get vitals.  Bruiser Fiora (because she's not a tank) needs 4-6 hits to do that much damage, especially against squishies.  Full AD Fiora, however, is very high risk/high reward - she'll absolutely destroy anything in her path, but CC or denying her the ult heal will cause her to explode.  Bruiser Fiora's damage output seems a lot higher just because she survives long enough to get the damage out reliably.  It offers the traditional bruiser package - good sustained dps with good survivability, as opposed to the extreme burst damage of AD Fiora.

See, blowing up tanks shouldn't be a thing. I understand if true damage is Riot's fetish and all, but just give Fiora %current HP physical damage so that people can survive her burst if they build items to do exactly that. 

Either that, or make a tank QSS item.

Isn't building damage supposed to be an high risk, high reward strategy on any champion?

For example, building AP on Malphite is risky because he is melee, immobile, and supposed to be built tanky, but at the end, it rewards even more than building him tanky, thanks to the 100% AP scaling on Malphite ult; if you play him correctly you can do insane damage during a teamfight and also CC them.

Also, the reason why Bruiser Fiora tends to actually do more damage than full AD Fiora is because Bruiser Fiora has more survivability, she will last for longer and thus will have more time to do damage against enemies. Sure, full AD Fiora is technically more rewarding because she can potentially burst down an enemy in less time, but in the end, Bruiser Fiora is actually the more rewarding one because you have an easier time doing damage to the enemies, at the cost of having less damage potential.

That's why I like to use AD Fizz. He is technically less rewarding than AP Fizz which can just burst down an enemy in 2 seconds - but he is less risky thanks to his tankyness.

Fiora isn't effective pure tank, as far as I know. I tried it several times; her bonus AD ratios are just too extreme. She needs 2-3 AD items to really feel the power, but I will give you that she can tank from then on and become a real nuisance. To that effect, I feel she falls under Yasuo territory, and while I don't condone such mobilie characters getting that much power so quickly, at least she stays single-target throughout.

It would be nice if her mobility was somewhat gated, like Yasuo needing an enemy unit. An 8-second cooldown on Q doesn't do that; situationally longer cooldown than Nidalee Pounce, but longer range, and I think quicker animation. However, she's relatively easy to chain-CC (just bait W out), and with ADC buffs and Tenacity nerfs, I feel the CC has gotten extreme enough in games that she's counterable. I don't like Riot's method of balance in this fashion, but beating her can be done in many situations. Just not solo (she is a duelist).
Actually 2 bruiser items are enough. Titanic hydra(50 AD, 400 hp), and TBC(55 AD, 300 hp) will make her do enough damage, you can go full tank after those.

Everyone goes 1-2 offensive items, even most tank supports now. However, she's gated at 2-3 because she has no choice; she's maybe the most melee kit there is now. Sure, most bulky champs are melee, and you can argue that mobility gives you range, but she has no definite hard CC to keep a victim from safety, and *sometimes is forced to go all the way behind her target to activate the bulk of her damage*. You're basically forced to have most of a kit with her to do anything at all, really. 2 damage items are needed to have damage, but 2 defensive items are highly suggested to make her not pop before she gets 2 vitals. If she's allowed to run circles around one champion, yeah, she'll whomp ya, but she has no realistic initiating capacity, and still falls to ganks if applied the right pressure.

Now, I'm not saying she's UP or anything. What I am saying is that she has a very high power spike after 2 damage items because she has to; a full tank build is just silly pitiful, and a full damage build will pop quicker than anyone else... even 3+ AD items is risky. And most of my point, *she's definitely not truly tanky, no matter the build*. She will never be a worthy initiator, and her damage-soaking capabilities are nearly non-existent. It's just that sharp damage if you don't clip those wings by way of teamfights.

I think what OP means by Tank Fiora is her usual Titantic into Cleaver into Tank build, which is probably the most optimal build with the exception of steraks. Full Tank Fiora is almost as bad as Full Tank Renekton. But yeah, Fiora is op, though i think Gangplank is a much bigger problem in higher brackets of play.

Yes, i know that Vayne has had it forever, but she needs 3 (continuous) attacks to proc it.  Fiora, if played to her max potential and scaling, can proc a passive mark nearly every attack, and do 12+% per auto not even going full AD. (think 2 items + runes) 

It doesnt matter about her base damages or scaling, Fiora in her current state will always do the same thing because there is NO way to stop single hit procs for %max health true damage

Can we not nerf what makes the meele carry ticks.

One problem is that Titanic is such a better build path than Ravenous AND its a free swap once finished. Fix that then lets see where Fiora lands.

Fiora actually have rather mediocre base damage.
Her vitals start at 3% maximum health true damage and scales with bonus AD.

Her Q has good bonus AD scaling and decent base, but ultimately it is only on par with an auto attack.

Her E only modifies the damage on her AAs, and her ultimate just equals 4 of her passive vitals.
Fiora has no where near the base damage Ekko used to have.

Fiora is extremely potent building bruiser / tank items for a different reason. By building health and defense, Fiora is able to survive longer to proc more vitals. The vitals and Grand Challenge will heal Fiora, which will allow her to fight longer. (LF helps tremendously in this regard.)

Additionally, because Fiora deals % maximum health true damage, it eventually reaches a point where it is more economical to kill the enemy in 4 - 6 hits instead of 2 - 3 hits in order to build more tank items instead. 

It is not that tank build is too effective on Fiora, bur rather that it was never optimal for her to build full damage in the first place. As a top laner, this isn't particularly a bad thing. Against naturally tanky champions such as Mundo, Graves, or Tahm Kench, Fiora needs to be able to take hits as well to survive.

However, in the current Meta Mundo, Graves, or Kench can beat most champions 1 v 1 as well. The problem isn't just with Fiora, but that many top lane champions are extremely strong this patch.

If Fiora is to be nerfed, it will ironically be done to her extreme AD scaling instead. If you take away the 3% base damage she will almost have no base damage in her kit left.

In the mean time, just play Kayle or Lulu against her. She struggles against slows, range poke, shields, and heals. Kayle and Lulu provides almost all of these tools.

A very good point that while Fiora can build full AD and be an assassin, building a few defensive items is not the same as building Tank. Pure tank Fiora lacks the damage to be a true threat in a team fight and poses no threat when the other 4 members of her team die. She could possibly be a bit of a split push threat in the sense that she might be tough to kill, but the actual pressure she'd put on a lane is minimal compared to just grouping up and winning the 5v4 teamfight and easily pushing faster. The bigger issue of sorts like you say is, as has pretty much always been, is that top lane champs snowball more so than most lanes. That's the entire purpose of top lane though and is something that teams have to actually play around more. Claiming that Fiora or Graves is not your problem for the first 15 minutes of the game is exactly why they become your problem 20 minutes in.
Tank Fiora honestly is one of the dumbest things in League aside Devourer Jax/Shyv/Yi.
Nerf base. Increase scaling. That ought to work.

Why "nerf base damage, buff scaling" can't work, simply put :
Fiora's core items are AD and tankiness. But Titanic and Black Cleaver grant an amount of AD that's rather similar to pure AD items, therefore if her scalings get buffed she'll be even stronger with her kit than before. Since AD means % health true damage (#healthyritomechanics) for Fiora, she doesn't need anything a melee carry would also need. That is critchance, armor pen (mostly flat to deal with squishies). Where people would rather buy Youmuu's for an assassin, Fiora doesn't care. She can get both AD and tankiness with an item that is perfectly balanced for other champions but stupid on Fiora due to her kit.

Buffing scalings won't change anything. Tanky Fiora has insane amounts of AD lategame
{{item:3047}} {{item:3748}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3156}} {{item:3072}} ?

Buffing her scalings will NOT work, people. Remove the %health true damage and change it to physical (with potentially some free arpen to be nice, but not too much).
That way she has to actually build some other stats than raw stupid AD to be a monster and be able to build bruisery with that.

Easy: She's trash if she can't hit the vitals. She has to be able to literally run circles around her opponent, or the whole minigame of her passive is irrelevant and she becomes vastly less effective. Fiora, unlike Riven, doesn't have 4 rapid-fire untargeted dashes, and can only move that quickly in combat. "Tank Fiora" isn't a thing. She is a fighter. Fighters build defensively, but they are NOT tanks. Tank Ekko was a thing because he could build full tank and still contribute a large amount of utility and significant damage. Fiora building full tank is pretty much useless, as she has nowhere near Ekko's level of utility and only deals a lot of damage if she builds for it. She doesn't deal enormous damage at all stages of the game. Her early game, pre-item damage isn't very good at all, and she relies on hitting vitals to win trades before running away (because she won't win a sustained fight before her first back â€” at least not since her base stats were nerfed). So, not only is Tank Fiora not a problem, but it's not even a thing that happens.
